event.descr:
This trap indicates that an Unsecure Access Point is detected by an Air Monitor located at wlsrLocation on channel wlsrCurrentChannel. The AP is declared unsecure, because we macthed it to the wlsrMatchedMac/wlsrMatchedIp.

wlsrTargetApBSSID %parm[#1]%;

wlsrTargetApSSID %parm[#2]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#3]%;

wlsrCurrentChannel %parm[#4]%;

wlsrMatchedMac %parm[#5]%;

wlsrMatchedIp %parm[#6]%;

wlsrRogueInfoURL %parm[#7]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrUnsecureApDetected trap received wlsrTargetApBSSID=%parm[#1]% wlsrTargetApSSID=%parm[#2]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#3]% wlsrCurrentChannel=%parm[#4]% wlsrMatchedMac=%parm[#5]% wlsrMatchedIp=%parm[#6]% wlsrRogueInfoURL=%parm[#7]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an AM at location wlsrLocation detected a Station impersonation.

wlsrNodeMac %parm[#1]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#2]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrStaImpersonation trap received wlsrNodeMac=%parm[#1]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#2]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an Access Point is detected by an AP at location wlsrLocation, which violates the Reserved Channel configuration.

wlsrTargetApBSSID %parm[#1]%;

wlsrTargetApSSID %parm[#2]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#3]%;

wlsrCurrentChannel %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrReservedChannelViolation trap received wlsrTargetApBSSID=%parm[#1]% wlsrTargetApSSID=%parm[#2]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#3]% wlsrCurrentChannel=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an Access Point voilating Valid SSID is detected by an AP at wlsrLocation.

wlsrTargetApBSSID %parm[#1]%;

wlsrTargetApSSID %parm[#2]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#3]%;

wlsrCurrentChannel %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrValidSSIDViolation trap received wlsrTargetApBSSID=%parm[#1]% wlsrTargetApSSID=%parm[#2]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#3]% wlsrCurrentChannel=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an Access Point has a bad channel configuration.

wlsrTargetApBSSID %parm[#1]%;

wlsrTargetApSSID %parm[#2]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#3]%;

wlsrCurrentChannel %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrChannelMisconfiguration trap received wlsrTargetApBSSID=%parm[#1]% wlsrTargetApSSID=%parm[#2]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#3]% wlsrCurrentChannel=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an Access Point has bad OUI configuration.

wlsrTargetApBSSID %parm[#1]%;

wlsrTargetApSSID %parm[#2]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#3]%;

wlsrCurrentChannel %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrOUIMisconfiguration trap received wlsrTargetApBSSID=%parm[#1]% wlsrTargetApSSID=%parm[#2]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#3]% wlsrCurrentChannel=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an Access Point has bad SSID configuration.

wlsrTargetApBSSID %parm[#1]%;

wlsrTargetApSSID %parm[#2]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#3]%;

wlsrCurrentChannel %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrSSIDMisconfiguration trap received wlsrTargetApBSSID=%parm[#1]% wlsrTargetApSSID=%parm[#2]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#3]% wlsrCurrentChannel=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an Access Point has bad Short preamble configuration.

wlsrTargetApBSSID %parm[#1]%;

wlsrTargetApSSID %parm[#2]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#3]%;

wlsrCurrentChannel %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrShortPreableMisconfiguration trap received wlsrTargetApBSSID=%parm[#1]% wlsrTargetApSSID=%parm[#2]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#3]% wlsrCurrentChannel=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an Access Point has bad WPA configuration.

wlsrTargetApBSSID %parm[#1]%;

wlsrTargetApSSID %parm[#2]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#3]%;

wlsrCurrentChannel %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrWPAMisconfiguration trap received wlsrTargetApBSSID=%parm[#1]% wlsrTargetApSSID=%parm[#2]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#3]% wlsrCurrentChannel=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an AM has detected an Adhoc network.

wlsrTargetApBSSID %parm[#1]%;

wlsrTargetApSSID %parm[#2]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#3]%;

wlsrCurrentChannel %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrAdhocNetworkDetected trap received wlsrTargetApBSSID=%parm[#1]% wlsrTargetApSSID=%parm[#2]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#3]% wlsrCurrentChannel=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that a Valid Station policy is violated.

wlsrTargetApBSSID %parm[#1]%;

wlsrNodeMac %parm[#2]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#3]%;

wlsrCurrentChannel %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrStaPolicyViolation trap received wlsrTargetApBSSID=%parm[#1]% wlsrNodeMac=%parm[#2]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#3]% wlsrCurrentChannel=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an AP/AM detected a Repeat WEP-IV violation.

wlsrTargetApBSSID %parm[#1]%;

wlsrTargetApSSID %parm[#2]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#3]%;

wlsrCurrentChannel %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrRepeatWEPIVViolation trap received wlsrTargetApBSSID=%parm[#1]% wlsrTargetApSSID=%parm[#2]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#3]% wlsrCurrentChannel=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an AP/AM detected a Weak WEP-IV violation.

wlsrTargetApBSSID %parm[#1]%;

wlsrTargetApSSID %parm[#2]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#3]%;

wlsrCurrentChannel %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrWeakWEPIVViolation trap received wlsrTargetApBSSID=%parm[#1]% wlsrTargetApSSID=%parm[#2]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#3]% wlsrCurrentChannel=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an AM/AP located at wlsrLocation has detected a channel interference on wlsrCurrentChannel.

wlsrLocation %parm[#1]%;

wlsrCurrentChannel %parm[#2]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrChannelInterferenceDetected trap received wlsrLocation=%parm[#1]% wlsrCurrentChannel=%parm[#2]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an AM/AP located at wlsrLocation has detected an AP interference on wlsrCurrentChannel.

wlsrTargetApBSSID %parm[#1]%;

wlsrTargetApSSID %parm[#2]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#3]%;

wlsrCurrentChannel %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrAPInterferenceDetected trap received wlsrTargetApBSSID=%parm[#1]% wlsrTargetApSSID=%parm[#2]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#3]% wlsrCurrentChannel=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an AM/AP located at wlsrLocation has detected a Station interference on wlsrCurrentChannel.

wlsrTargetApBSSID %parm[#1]%;

wlsrTargetApSSID %parm[#2]%;

wlsrNodeMac %parm[#3]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#4]%;

wlsrCurrentChannel %parm[#5]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrStaInterferenceDetected trap received wlsrTargetApBSSID=%parm[#1]% wlsrTargetApSSID=%parm[#2]% wlsrNodeMac=%parm[#3]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#4]% wlsrCurrentChannel=%parm[#5]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an AM/AP located at wlsrLocation is reporting that an AP wlsrTargetApBSSID has exceeded an upper threshold for Frame Retry Rate for AP wlsrTargetApBSSID.

wlsrTargetApBSSID %parm[#1]%;

wlsrTargetApSSID %parm[#2]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#3]%;

wlsrCurrentChannel %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrFrameRetryRateExceeded trap received wlsrTargetApBSSID=%parm[#1]% wlsrTargetApSSID=%parm[#2]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#3]% wlsrCurrentChannel=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an AM/AP located at wlsrLocation is reporting that an AP wlsrTargetApBSSID has exceeded an upper threshold for Frame Receive Error Rate for AP wlsrTargetApBSSID.

wlsrTargetApBSSID %parm[#1]%;

wlsrTargetApSSID %parm[#2]%;

wlsrTargetApChannel %parm[#3]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrFrameReceiveErrorRateExceeded trap received wlsrTargetApBSSID=%parm[#1]% wlsrTargetApSSID=%parm[#2]% wlsrTargetApChannel=%parm[#3]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an AM/AP located at wlsrLocation is reporting that an AP wlsrTargetApBSSID has exceeded an upper threshold for Frame Fragmentation Rate for AP wlsrTargetApBSSID.

wlsrTargetApBSSID %parm[#1]%;

wlsrTargetApSSID %parm[#2]%;

wlsrTargetApChannel %parm[#3]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrFrameFragmentationRateExceeded trap received wlsrTargetApBSSID=%parm[#1]% wlsrTargetApSSID=%parm[#2]% wlsrTargetApChannel=%parm[#3]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an AM/AP located at wlsrLocation is reporting that a station wlsrStaAddress has exceeded the allocated Bandwidth rate.

wlsrNodeMac %parm[#1]%;

wlsrTargetApBSSID %parm[#2]%;

wlsrTargetApSSID %parm[#3]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#4]%;

wlsrCurrentChannel %parm[#5]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrFrameBandWidthRateExceeded trap received wlsrNodeMac=%parm[#1]% wlsrTargetApBSSID=%parm[#2]% wlsrTargetApSSID=%parm[#3]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#4]% wlsrCurrentChannel=%parm[#5]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an AM/AP located at wlsrLocation is reporting that a station wlsrStaAddress has exceeded the Low speed rate.

wlsrNodeMac %parm[#1]%;

wlsrTargetApBSSID %parm[#2]%;

wlsrTargetApSSID %parm[#3]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#4]%;

wlsrCurrentChannel %parm[#5]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrFrameLowSpeedRateExceeded trap received wlsrNodeMac=%parm[#1]% wlsrTargetApBSSID=%parm[#2]% wlsrTargetApSSID=%parm[#3]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#4]% wlsrCurrentChannel=%parm[#5]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an AM/AP located at wlsrLocation is reporting that a station wlsrStaAddress has exceeded the Non Unicast traffic rate.

wlsrNodeMac %parm[#1]%;

wlsrTargetApBSSID %parm[#2]%;

wlsrTargetApSSID %parm[#3]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#4]%;

wlsrCurrentChannel %parm[#5]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrFrameNonUnicastRateExceeded trap received wlsrNodeMac=%parm[#1]% wlsrTargetApBSSID=%parm[#2]% wlsrTargetApSSID=%parm[#3]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#4]% wlsrCurrentChannel=%parm[#5]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an AM/AP located at wlsrLocation is reporting that an AP with BSSID wlsrTargetApBSSID has enabled Load balancing.

wlsrTargetApBSSID %parm[#1]%;

wlsrTargetApSSID %parm[#2]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#3]%;

wlsrCurrentChannel %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrLoadbalancingEnabled trap received wlsrTargetApBSSID=%parm[#1]% wlsrTargetApSSID=%parm[#2]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#3]% wlsrCurrentChannel=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an AM/AP located at wlsrLocation is reporting that it exceeded an upper threshold for Frame Retry Rate.

wlsrLocation %parm[#1]%;

wlsrCurrentChannel %parm[#2]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrChannelFrameRetryRateExceeded trap received wlsrLocation=%parm[#1]% wlsrCurrentChannel=%parm[#2]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an AM/AP located at wlsrLocation is reporting that it exceeded an upper threshold for Frame Fragmentation Rate.

wlsrLocation %parm[#1]%;

wlsrCurrentChannel %parm[#2]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrChannelFrameFragmentationRateExceeded trap received wlsrLocation=%parm[#1]% wlsrCurrentChannel=%parm[#2]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an AM/AP located at wlsrLocation is reporting that it exceeded an upper threshold for Frame Error Rate.

wlsrLocation %parm[#1]%;

wlsrCurrentChannel %parm[#2]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrChannelFrameErrorRateExceeded trap received wlsrLocation=%parm[#1]% wlsrCurrentChannel=%parm[#2]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that we detected a signature match.

wlsrSignatureName %parm[#1]%;

wlsrSourceMac %parm[#2]%;

wlsrRSSI %parm[#3]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrSignatureMatch trap received wlsrSignatureName=%parm[#1]% wlsrSourceMac=%parm[#2]% wlsrRSSI=%parm[#3]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an AP/AM at wlsrLocation detected frames of type wlsrFrameType on wlsrCurrentChannel which exceeds the configured IDS rate threshold.

wlsrFrameType %parm[#1]%;

associateRequest(1) associateResponse(2) reassociateRequest(3) reassociateResponse(4) probeRequest(5) probeResponse(6) beacon(9) atim(10) disassociate(11) auth(12) deauth(13)

wlsrLocation %parm[#2]%;

wlsrCurrentChannel %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrChannelRateAnomaly trap received wlsrFrameType=%parm[#1]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#2]% wlsrCurrentChannel=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an AP/AM at wlsrLocation detected frames of type wlsrFrameType transmitted by node wlsrNodeMac which exceeds the configured IDS rate threshold.

wlsrFrameType %parm[#1]%;

associateRequest(1) associateResponse(2) reassociateRequest(3) reassociateResponse(4) probeRequest(5) probeResponse(6) beacon(9) atim(10) disassociate(11) auth(12) deauth(13)

wlsrNodeMac %parm[#2]%;

wlsrRSSI %parm[#3]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrNodeRateAnomaly trap received wlsrFrameType=%parm[#1]% wlsrNodeMac=%parm[#2]% wlsrRSSI=%parm[#3]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that the number of EAP Handshake packets received by an AP/AM at wlsrLocation exceeds the configured IDS EAP Handshake rate.

wlsrLocation %parm[#1]%;

wlsrCurrentChannel %parm[#2]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrEAPRateAnomaly trap received wlsrLocation=%parm[#1]% wlsrCurrentChannel=%parm[#2]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an AP/AM at wlsrLocation detected a Signal Anomaly on wlsrCurrentChannel.

wlsrLocation %parm[#1]%;

wlsrCurrentChannel %parm[#2]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrSignalAnomaly trap received wlsrLocation=%parm[#1]% wlsrCurrentChannel=%parm[#2]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an AP/AM at wlsrLocation received packets which exceeds the acceptable sequence number difference. The acceptable sequence number difference is an IDS Configuration object.

wlsrSourceMac %parm[#1]%;

wlsrRSSI %parm[#2]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrSequenceNumberAnomaly trap received wlsrSourceMac=%parm[#1]% wlsrRSSI=%parm[#2]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an AP/AM detected a station Disconnect attack.

wlsrFrameType %parm[#1]%;

associateRequest(1) associateResponse(2) reassociateRequest(3) reassociateResponse(4) probeRequest(5) probeResponse(6) beacon(9) atim(10) disassociate(11) auth(12) deauth(13)

wlsrSourceMac %parm[#2]%;

wlsrRSSI %parm[#3]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrDisconnectStationAttack trap received wlsrFrameType=%parm[#1]% wlsrSourceMac=%parm[#2]% wlsrRSSI=%parm[#3]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This trap is triggered when the number of spurious AP's detected by an AP/AM at wlsrLocation exceeds the configured IDS threshold.

wlsrLocation %parm[#1]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrApFloodAttack trap received wlsrLocation=%parm[#1]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an AP/AM at wlsrLocation detected an Adhoc Network. Node wlsrSourceMac is connected to an adhoc AP wlsrTargetApBSSID with wlsrTargetApSSID ssid.

wlsrSourceMac %parm[#1]%;

wlsrTargetApBSSID %parm[#2]%;

wlsrTargetApSSID %parm[#3]%;

wlsrRSSI %parm[#4]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#5]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrAdhocNetwork trap received wlsrSourceMac=%parm[#1]% wlsrTargetApBSSID=%parm[#2]% wlsrTargetApSSID=%parm[#3]% wlsrRSSI=%parm[#4]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#5]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an AP/AM at wlsrLocation detected a Wireless Bridge. The detected bridge is between wlsrSourceMac and wlsrReceiverMac.

wlsrTransmitterMac %parm[#1]%;

wlsrReceiverMac %parm[#2]%;

wlsrRSSI %parm[#3]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrWirelessBridge trap received wlsrTransmitterMac=%parm[#1]% wlsrReceiverMac=%parm[#2]% wlsrRSSI=%parm[#3]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an AP/AM at wlsrLocation detected an Invalid MAC OUI in transmission from the Node wlsrNodeMac. The invalid mac is the wlsrAddressType.

wlsrAddressType %parm[#1]%;

srcAddress(1) dstAddress(2) bssid(3)

wlsrNodeMac %parm[#2]%;

wlsrRSSI %parm[#3]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrInvalidMacOUI trap received wlsrAddressType=%parm[#1]% wlsrNodeMac=%parm[#2]% wlsrRSSI=%parm[#3]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an AM/AP located at wlsrLocation is reporting that an AP with BSSID wlsrTargetApBSSID has disabled Load balacing.

wlsrTargetApBSSID %parm[#1]%;

wlsrTargetApSSID %parm[#2]%;

wlsrTargetApChannel %parm[#3]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrLoadbalancingDisabled trap received wlsrTargetApBSSID=%parm[#1]% wlsrTargetApSSID=%parm[#2]% wlsrTargetApChannel=%parm[#3]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an Access Point has bad WEP configuration.

wlsrTargetApBSSID %parm[#1]%;

wlsrTargetApSSID %parm[#2]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#3]%;

wlsrCurrentChannel %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrWEPMisconfiguration trap received wlsrTargetApBSSID=%parm[#1]% wlsrTargetApSSID=%parm[#2]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#3]% wlsrCurrentChannel=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an AP/AM detected a Repeat WEP-IV violation. for a Station

wlsrTargetApBSSID %parm[#1]%;

wlsrTargetApSSID %parm[#2]%;

wlsrNodeMac %parm[#3]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#4]%;

wlsrCurrentChannel %parm[#5]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrStaRepeatWEPIVViolation trap received wlsrTargetApBSSID=%parm[#1]% wlsrTargetApSSID=%parm[#2]% wlsrNodeMac=%parm[#3]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#4]% wlsrCurrentChannel=%parm[#5]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an AP/AM detected a Weak WEP-IV violation. for a Station

wlsrTargetApBSSID %parm[#1]%;

wlsrTargetApSSID %parm[#2]%;

wlsrNodeMac %parm[#3]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#4]%;

wlsrCurrentChannel %parm[#5]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrStaWeakWEPIVViolation trap received wlsrTargetApBSSID=%parm[#1]% wlsrTargetApSSID=%parm[#2]% wlsrNodeMac=%parm[#3]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#4]% wlsrCurrentChannel=%parm[#5]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that a station with wlsrNodeMac associated with an Unsecure Access Point wlsrTargetApBSSID. This is detected by an Air Monitor located at wlsrLocation on channel wlsrCurrentChannel.

wlsrTargetApBSSID %parm[#1]%;

wlsrTargetApSSID %parm[#2]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#3]%;

wlsrCurrentChannel %parm[#4]%;

wlsrNodeMac %parm[#5]%;

wlsrRogueInfoURL %parm[#6]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrStaAssociatedToUnsecureAp trap received wlsrTargetApBSSID=%parm[#1]% wlsrTargetApSSID=%parm[#2]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#3]% wlsrCurrentChannel=%parm[#4]% wlsrNodeMac=%parm[#5]% wlsrRogueInfoURL=%parm[#6]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an AM has detected an Adhoc network that is bridging to a wired network

wlsrSourceMac %parm[#1]%;

wlsrTargetApBSSID %parm[#2]%;

wlsrTargetApSSID %parm[#3]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#4]%;

wlsrCurrentChannel %parm[#5]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrAdhocNetworkBridgeDetected trap received wlsrSourceMac=%parm[#1]% wlsrTargetApBSSID=%parm[#2]% wlsrTargetApSSID=%parm[#3]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#4]% wlsrCurrentChannel=%parm[#5]%

event.descr:
This trap indicates that an Interfering Access Point is detected by an Air Monitor located at wlsrLocation on channel wlsrCurrentChannel.

wlsrTargetApBSSID %parm[#1]%;

wlsrTargetApSSID %parm[#2]%;

wlsrLocation %parm[#3]%;

wlsrCurrentChannel %parm[#4]%;

wlsrInterferingAPInfoURL %parm[#5]%;
event.logmsg: wlsrInterferingApDetected trap received wlsrTargetApBSSID=%parm[#1]% wlsrTargetApSSID=%parm[#2]% wlsrLocation=%parm[#3]% wlsrCurrentChannel=%parm[#4]% wlsrInterferingAPInfoURL=%parm[#5]%
